column4: Yesterday I've  got an automatic  distupgrade via the normal update notifier. This strikes me as strange since I'm already running 10.10. Does anyone have a clue why this might happen?
if OSS is back in 11.04 I won't complain.
ive heard no news of Linus accepting OSS, so no probably not
so it was Linus that acknowledged the removal of OSS from the kernel? I thought this was an Ubuntu-only choice.
abandoning OSS makes my Wine pretty much useless for games

it was removed upstream for licensing reasons and replaced with ALSA. Additionally, Linus does not permit any floating point arithmetic in the kernel, which OSS does use, so it's unlikely it'll be reaccepted upstream any time soon
do you know any solid solution for the slew of Windows games that *require* OSS to have any sound whatsoever?
there is a compatibility layer to let pulseaudio and alsa handle them
should all be there by default...
ALSA does not work, nor does Pulse. when selected, Wine crashes those games involved completely
i suggest talking to wine devs then, if they're handling the api oddly
the removal of OSS also breaks several video frontends, like MythTV
im sure that's not true. OSS hasnt been in the kernel for a couple of years now, and i've used MythTV just fine
I might just do that, talk to the Wine devs...
thats fine, but my point is that Myth has worked for me and OSS hasnt been around the whole time ive used linux, so therefore...myth works without oss
well then I'll just keep my fingers crossed and start the upgrade.
groundup, if only that "distro" from Redmond would be so transparent about it's updates...;-)
